byline.contributor: Patricia Torres contributed reporting from San Antonio del Táchira, and Susan Abad from Cúcuta, Colombia.

abstract: Residents of Venezuelan border town of San Antonio del Tachira are mystified by state of emergency declaration from Pres Nicolas Maduro;  critics say edict, ostensibly aimed at controlling paramilitaries, criminals and other threats to country's stability, is actually meant to distract Venezuelans from pressing problems, including a collapsing economy.
lead_paragraph: A state of emergency at the border town of San Antonio del Táchira has shown arbitrary policing and few changes in daily public activity.

headline.main: In a Venezuelan Border Town, a State of Emergency Is Barely Perceptible
headline.print_headline: In a Venezuelan Town, a State of Emergency Is Barely Perceptible

snippet: A state of emergency at the border town of San Antonio del Táchira has shown arbitrary policing and few changes in daily public activity.
